## Introduction

This notebook performs univariate analysis on each feature of the Iris dataset.

## Load Libraries

```{r libraries}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(gridExtra)
library(psych)
```

## Load Data

```{r load_data}
data_path <- file.path("..", "..", "data", "Iris.csv")
iris_data <- read.csv(data_path)
features <- c("sepal.length", "sepal.width", "petal.length", "petal.width")
```

## Descriptive Statistics

```{r descriptive}
# Univariate statistics for each feature
for (feature in features) {
  cat("\n", "=", rep("=", 78), "\n", sep = "")
  cat("UNIVARIATE ANALYSIS: ", feature, "\n", sep = "")
  cat("=", rep("=", 78), "\n", sep = "")
  cat("Mean:", mean(iris_data[[feature]]), "\n")
  cat("Median:", median(iris_data[[feature]]), "\n")
  cat("Std Dev:", sd(iris_data[[feature]]), "\n")
  cat("Variance:", var(iris_data[[feature]]), "\n")
  cat("Min:", min(iris_data[[feature]]), "\n")
  cat("Max:", max(iris_data[[feature]]), "\n")
  cat("Range:", max(iris_data[[feature]]) - min(iris_data[[feature]]), "\n")
  cat("IQR:", IQR(iris_data[[feature]]), "\n")
}
```

## Distribution Plots

```{r distributions}
# Histograms for each feature
plots <- list()
for (feature in features) {
  p <- ggplot(iris_data, aes_string(x = feature)) +
    geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "steelblue", alpha = 0.7, color = "black") +
    geom_vline(xintercept = mean(iris_data[[feature]]), 
               color = "red", linestyle = "dashed", size = 1) +
    geom_vline(xintercept = median(iris_data[[feature]]), 
               color = "green", linestyle = "dashed", size = 1) +
    labs(title = paste("Distribution of", feature),
         x = feature, y = "Frequency") +
    theme_minimal()
  plots[[feature]] <- p
}

do.call(grid.arrange, c(plots, ncol = 2))
```

## Box Plots

```{r boxplots}
# Box plots for each feature
plots <- list()
for (feature in features) {
  p <- ggplot(iris_data, aes_string(y = feature)) +
    geom_boxplot(fill = "steelblue", alpha = 0.7) +
    labs(title = feature, y = "Value") +
    theme_minimal() +
    coord_flip()
  plots[[feature]] <- p
}

do.call(grid.arrange, c(plots, ncol = 4))
```

## Q-Q Plots

```{r qqplots}
# Q-Q plots for normality assessment
plots <- list()
for (feature in features) {
  p <- ggplot(iris_data, aes_string(sample = feature)) +
    stat_qq() +
    stat_qq_line() +
    labs(title = paste("Q-Q Plot:", feature)) +
    theme_minimal()
  plots[[feature]] <- p
}

do.call(grid.arrange, c(plots, ncol = 2))
```

## Summary

Univariate analysis reveals the distribution and characteristics of each feature individually.
